message.content:
1. Which AWS service provides a scalable computing capacity in the cloud?
   a) Amazon S3
   b) Amazon EC2
   c) Amazon RDS
   d) Amazon VPC
   Answer: b) Amazon EC2
   Explanation: Amazon EC2 (Elastic Compute Cloud) provides resizable compute capacity in the cloud. It allows users to quickly scale up or down their computing resources based on demand.
   Reference: Learn more about Amazon EC2 - https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/

2. Which AWS service is used to store and retrieve data objects?
   a) Amazon S3
   b) Amazon RDS
   c) Amazon VPC
   d) Amazon CloudFront
   Answer: a) Amazon S3
   Explanation: Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service) provides object storage in the cloud. It is designed to store and retrieve any amount of data from anywhere on the web.
   Reference: Learn more about Amazon S3 - https://aws.amazon.com/s3/

3. Which AWS service is used to set up and manage a relational database?
   a) Amazon S3
   b) Amazon EC2
   c) Amazon RDS
   d) Amazon VPC
   Answer: c) Amazon RDS
   Explanation: Amazon RDS (Relational Database Service) is a fully managed relational database service by AWS. It supports various database engines like MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, etc.
   Reference: Learn more about Amazon RDS - https://aws.amazon.com/rds/

4. Which AWS service is used to manage and deploy serverless applications?
   a) AWS Lambda
   b) Amazon S3
   c) Amazon EC2
   d) Amazon VPC
   Answer: a) AWS Lambda
   Explanation: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service provided by AWS. It allows developers to run code without provisioning or managing servers.
   Reference: Learn more about AWS Lambda - https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/

5. Which AWS service is used to distribute content globally?
   a) Amazon S3
   b) Amazon CloudFront
   c) Amazon RDS
   d) Amazon VPC
   Answer: b) Amazon CloudFront
   Explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a content delivery network (CDN) service by AWS. It helps deliver static and dynamic web content to users with low latency from edge locations around the world.
   Reference: Learn more about Amazon CloudFront - https://aws.amazon.com/cloudfront/

6. Which AWS service is used to monitor and gain insights into your applications and infrastructure?
   a) Amazon S3
   b) Amazon CloudWatch
   c) Amazon RDS
   d) Amazon VPC
   Answer: b) Amazon CloudWatch
   Explanation: Amazon CloudWatch is a monitoring and observability service by AWS. It collects and tracks metrics, logs, and events, allowing you to gain insights and take automated actions.
   Reference: Learn more about Amazon CloudWatch - https://aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/

7. Which AWS service is used for managing and scaling containerized applications?
   a) AWS Lambda
   b) Amazon S3
   c) Amazon EC2
   d) Amazon ECS
   Answer: d) Amazon ECS
   Explanation: Amazon ECS (Elastic Container Service) is a highly scalable container orchestration service provided by AWS. It allows you to run and manage Docker containers on a cluster of EC2 instances.
   Reference: Learn more about Amazon ECS - https://aws.amazon.com/ecs/

8. Which AWS service provides a secure and isolated virtual network in the cloud?
   a) Amazon S3
   b) Amazon EC2
   c) Amazon RDS
   d) Amazon VPC
   Answer: d) Amazon VPC
   Explanation: Amazon VPC (Virtual Private Cloud) allows you to provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud. It enables you to launch AWS resources in a virtual network that you define.
   Reference: Learn more about Amazon VPC - https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/

9. Which AWS service is used to automate infrastructure deployment and management?
   a) AWS Lambda
   b) AWS CloudFormation
   c) Amazon EC2
   d) Amazon CloudFront
   Answer: b) AWS CloudFormation
   Explanation: AWS CloudFormation is a service that helps you model and set up your Amazon Web Services resources so you can spend less time managing those resources and more time focusing on your applications that run in AWS.
   Reference: Learn more about AWS CloudFormation - https://aws.amazon.com/cloudformation/

10. Which AWS service is used for managing and securing user identities and resources?
    a) Amazon S3
    b) Amazon Cognito
    c) Amazon RDS
    d) Amazon VPC
    Answer: b) Amazon Cognito
    Explanation: Amazon Cognito is a fully managed identity service provided by AWS. It allows you to add user sign-up, sign-in, and access control to your web and mobile apps.
    Reference: Learn more about Amazon Cognito - https://aws.amazon.com/cognito/
